positive.review: It's a good game with simple strategy and you can have a lot of fun with your friends

the 1 thing i don't like about the game is that  you can only play so much with the limited coins. it deters me from playing the game. because of this its just sitting on my screen now, collecting dust. only play this if your fine with limited playing; otherwise it's a great game.
Wish I could just buy the game and not deal with needing to buy cosmetics or boards, but if you aren't hosting, it's really not a big deal. Much better than the mobile version.
Everything you love about the board game with the speed and ease of playing on a computer. Your troops will stay in their country, even if someone bumps your laptop.
I love this game. It's a simple game, but it can get very complicated.

Simple, fun, and surprisingly addictive.
Matches can swing fast, which keeps the game exciting.
Great to play with friends, and easy to pick up.
If you like light strategy games, this oneâ€™s worth it.

I vote for (Labor of Love Award 2025) Thank you SMG for all your continued support for this game from your humble beginnings to present time... Please add block player options in the lobby and allowed ranks settings in (create game/casual)
Classic game, plus a LOT of maps (at a cost).

I love Risk, it's one of my favorite strategy board games.  I have spent hours upon hours in real life with friends playing this game.  We all unanimously agree that this is hands down the best digital version.  Pogo had a good one for awhile on their website, but this is a lot easier and smoother to connect to with the cross platforms.  Buying the 'premium' version to play unlimited matches is not a lot imo for the quality you get and ongoing support.  That said, I don't advise buying the map packs.  I had initially got into this on the mobile.  Later on I began playing on my MacBook.  I took a hiatus for a few years and when I came back I noticed MANY of the map backs I bought, vanished.  It's wild that I would have to spend over $100 to get every single current map pack knowing that some may disappear for good after I buy them.  The rewards for leveling up are a joke as well.  There are some levels where the developers don't give you anything.  And when you do get in game tokens for leveling up, it's very small.  That said, at least none of the purchases can help you win.  All DLC is purely cosmetic and you don't need the map packs to play with someone who has them.  You only need them to host or practice on your own with bots.
A good game for the typical lover of the RISK board game - even if you want to play alone :)
New twists on old classic. Free base game play makes it good for casual play.  Other features ban be bought with the free gems, if you're willing to wait, or cash.  I have not tried PvP yet.

meilleur jeu entre potes, des amÃ©liorations possibles pour donner plus de place Ã  des parties plus RP que ce soit dans le temps imparti ou des rÃ¨gles supplÃ©mentaire mais en l'Ã©tat super pour tout le monde
Based on the board game with the same name Risk I recommend also playing the board game

I can say itâ€™s a pretty solid modern take on the classic board game. The overall experience is smooth, the visuals are clean, and the matchmaking is surprisingly quick most of the time.

The game nails that â€œone-more-turnâ€ feeling, especially when youâ€™re locked in a tense back-and-forth with another player over a continent. The animated dice rolls and attack sequences add some excitement without dragging the match out too long.

That said, the RNG can feel a bit brutal at times, and some matches really come down to lucky rolls rather than strategy. A few UI elements also feel slightly outdated, but nothing major that ruins the experience.

If youâ€™re into strategy games or you just enjoy the original RISK, this is definitely worth jumping into. Easy to pick up, fun with friends, and overall a solid way to scratch that competitive itch.
Plays like the original game but can be played with additional content. The community is always active and improving this game.
+rep as soon as I launched the game it gave me like 12 achievements ez achievementslop
Wonderful game of strategy, fun to play, competitive, and addicting, would recommend, you do tend to crash out over other players... but that's all in good fun!
game is good but sucks when your going against THOSE types of players like i lost more than once by trying to get the hang of it so i just gave up on it

Overall it is fun but I wish they would add medals or whatever they were called that were in risk factions. like the attack and defense die and the airfield. they could make the medals and capitals modifiers so you could have them in any mode or at least in classic domination if you wanted to.
Ok, es muy bueno, a;ade algunas cosas que la verdad no me interesan demasiado pero tambien conserva el risk clasico de toda la vida y sin complicaciones lo cual es genial,
I love risk, its the best board game out there. I play against the bots because people take too long to decide what to do, and in that sense I wish the bots were harder. Still love it nonetheless
I'm so engaged with this game, I play almost daily. However, it's a pity when you find player who doesn't respect alliances.

I absolutely loved this board game as a kid and SMG have done with this game is awesome, I would recommend this game. It is a lot of fun to play whether you play along or with friends, the online games are awesome and with all of the map packs to choose from the playability is great.
Its a fun board game that can keep you mentally sharp! Potential long paced games though so have the free time. Can play other game modes to shorten the games but Caps are the best.
A fun game with a new and beautiful concept.

The greatest version of Rust i've ever played by-far!!
This is so packed with content it's ridiculous and deserves more media attention!
Endless amount of game modes, huge creativity from the developers!!
Also online ranked multiplayer ladders to compete against people around the world.
im very very impressed!
-2 stars for preditory dlc abuse.

3/5 Stars
Turn based strategy games are fun to play and the variety of maps in this game keep it interesting.
This is a fun take on a classic game. I don't care for the gem/loot store, but the basic game is fun.

Fantastic game to play with friends. Beware of allying with the Dinolord, he does not keep his word.

For all the people who are commenting that this is a game of luck and teaming goes on, I assure you, you don't know what the game is.
It's a game of diplomacy and strategy. Funny how people who don't use their brain and don't learn from their mistakes actually get stuck at beginner level and ruin EVERY lobby they join. There's always that dumb noob who suicides into someone who did nothing except help him, or that player who leaves mid game because he's mad he couldn't hold europe on turn 2... and this is the exact type of people trashing the game
In short, if you have a brain and wanna think and chill and learn about political diplomacy and negationions, 11/10 game. Otherwise, snake and ladder is always an option ðŸ‘

7/10: would be 10/10 with the following.  Chat where you could type to each other in game. They have chats/emotes behind a paywall. I want to type things in game to friends or foes.  A money grab I dont like about this game. I also dont like the pay wall for those who dont purchase ablity to have unlimited tokens. Remove tokens....

good game but there is so much teaming going on that it makes games unplayable, you end up fighting 3 people who are in discord together and for some reason the devs still haven't sorted this problem out? 
7/10 for game play but they need to think of something to combat the teaming.

My favorite part of Morbius was when Jared Leto screamed "Risking Time," then slammed his army against the strongest player losing them both the critical game of Risk. 

Anyway It's a good game if you don't take it serious. It is thr best though if you have a big group of friends to play with.

When you wish to destroy friendships, just encourage your friends to join you in a match, and annihilate them. But very good for a strategic minded person to encourage their brain. The avators of the players are pretty fun too. And many awesome maps.

negative.review: When people lose, they report you and you get suspended with no recourse, no explanation.   No customer support, just a suspension for no actual reason.  Don't buy.

The game itself is fun and good, but I ran into a critical bug where the number wheel will not stop spinning infinitely. Reddit doesn't have any answers, just others running into the same issue, tried disabling controller input in steam and restarting and neither of those fixed it. It sucks since the bug makes the game literally unplayable and I was actually enjoying the gameplay of this. 

There also might be cheaters in the online portion. There were some players that would go in with like 25 troops against my 30 and would just take the territory while only losing like 5 troops. Idk how else to explain something like that without mentioning cheating.
the RNG dice game is rigged. i went 5 soldiers vs 1 soldier in single dice rolls and lost all soldiers. GG
Full of hackers who game the dice. A real shame as it makes what should be a great game absolutely terrible (strategy becomes redundant). Why people cheat is beyond me but that is another issue.

absolute 100% luck based. You CANNOT win with skill. Its full gambling. zero skill.
There are about 50% bots in the game (even in ranked) and they will play 100% random.
And it doesnt matter what you do, you will not outskill anyone here. Its 100% coinflip if u win

Same broken dice.  The game is not worth playing until the horrible dice programming is changed.   It is what it is.  Play it in person instead. Seems to also be a game built on micro-transactions.  And to answer the developer that responded before blocking me from playing the game again, the dice programming you claim to have fixed... its still broken.... badly... broken.
just cheaters, or people that stall, and when you finally get a decent match youll get rolled on cap 5v4 and they will lose only a troop on balanced blitz, its a joke, rarely update

The developers rig the dice rolls for the computer which makes the game unplayable. I am glad I wasted less than 5 minutes on this obvious nostalgia bait you into buying something. Even though the game is free you would have a much more valuable Risk experience playing the classic IRL version with real people and legittemate dice rolls.

You have to spend an in-game currency to play against offline bots. How do you get that currency? As far as I could immediately understand, you can purchase it. 

And then there's an option to "remove ads", which I hadn't seen yet, so I imagine they're coming.
AI needs to be adjusted.  AI goes after human player instead of other AI
Its a fun game but you can only play like 4 games a day for free.
A strategy game based entirely on luck. Genius.

dont really understand why i have to pay 5 tokens to play a game, where do these tokens come from? a mystery... Also played 3 games, cpu ganged up on me each time lol. Cpu wins attack with a 6 percent chance at winning, nice. fuck this game

if you want to play, sure. BUT if you want to have fun, then pay money, or you can play this games 24/7, and get a few funny moments per 100 hours, if you just a casual player, then do not play ever... Worst game on steam that I've ever played.

One of the worst risk games out there, run by a very shady company.  I highly recommend you avoid this.  This company openly acknowledges it's shady behaviour, too, on their discord server.  They regularly wrongly ban players who spend real money on the game, hoping it causes them to create a new account to re-purchased in-game content.  They don't even deny their methods.  Lawyers need to get involved.  As bad as that is, the players are some of the worst.  Cheaters are everywhere and nothing is done about it.  As far as I can tell, only legit players are punished.  Truly evil.  If not for cheaters, you have cowards who only accept new members (i.e., newbs) into their lobbies for easy wins.  

So., in summary: you rarely find a legitimate game, due to rampant cheating and cowards, and the game developers openly admit they ban you without cause, and they refuse to change their ways. AVOID THIS GAME!!!  I hope a lawyer see's this and sues them.

There are way older games with better graphics and a much more authentic Risk feeling then this game. When I say older I mean Risk II for windows 95/98, 32. MB storage (not ram, storage) 800x600 resolution. It looks and feels better then this. 

Also, this might shock folks int his day and age, you get to play the game. No points or extra cash needed, no cash for extra avatars or to start a game, you can always start a game. ALWAYS! You already bought the game, would be a shame if we charged you extra for starting a map in the game.
THere are hackers who load up on so many units.

After a 2 year break, I gave this another try. It's still broken. Multiple disconnections - hey it's not me (I have a VERY good internet connection), it's YOU with your 1980's servers. The developers are too busy being gen z discord wannabes and less interested in spending money on infrastructure. Great concept, wrong idiots in charge.
not a good game, too many sweats
Where is the vote kick button for afk players?
This game is like a trash can.

When people lose, they report you and you get suspended with no recourse, no explanation.   No customer support, just a suspension for no actual reason.  Don't buy.

Loved this game... for a while. Now, it's practically unplayable. I have excellent internet, but every game I play, various connection issues start messing up the game. I once played a game where all five opponents lost their connection, leaving me the victor. Now, I've lost six of my last seven games because of losing connection.

I suspect there's a cheat out there that people are using, because it comes up on my turn like clockwork, and I either lose my turn as I spend half of it 'waiting to reconnect', or when I'm about to win... oops! Signal lost. 

It wasn't like this in the beginning, but now... even the games where you stay until the end are ruined by it. I've read other complaints about it, but it nothing seems to get done. I can't handle playing for an hour, and then suddenly losing because of a lost connection, or constantly 're-doing' my turn becuase loss of signal starts me over at the start... OH! You ran out of time and your armies aren't properly situated. Too bad, so sad...

Maybe they'll fix this issue. I hope so... I don't mind losing. It's how you learn. But I can't stand this b******t. I've had enough. I'm out.

While I do quite like playing Risk on a board, I did not like what I was met with when I first opened the game. I immediately knew that I would dislike it, when I saw the UI, which looked nothing at all what a PC game ought to look like, but more like a direct port of a mobile game UI. The mobile game feel only increased as I opened what looked like a Supercell pay-to-win shop, which is something I absolutely cannot stand in my PC games.
That coupled with the limited games on F2P [strike] and the feeling of being constantly slowed down by the game due to the obnoxiously overused and slow animations [/strike] made my patience max out after one game.
At least I did not have to pay to reach the conclusion that I will not be opening this game of my own volition again.


Edit: It seems there is an in-game option to disable the animations, allowing for a snappier game feel. That one is on me for not searching for it.
Not a bad game, but super scammy. Feels like one of the classic mobile games designed to scam you into spending money on garbage in-game pixels

I love the board game of Risk.  But even with the options you have to control players uniting in a game.  I am done.  Always 2 players on some audio server getting on same match and co-operation between ruins the game.  I am uninstalling.

This game is completely overrun by hackers. Literally every single match has at least one.

In Fog of War, they can see the entire map, which ruins the whole point of the mode.

They attack impossibly fast, always having an unfair advantage.

Itâ€™s even worse in progressive card bonus mode, since they can snowball out of control instantly.

The core game itself could be fun, but right now itâ€™s unplayable because of the cheating problem. Unless the developers actually fix this, donâ€™t waste your time.

This game isn't actually free, each time you set up a new game you will have to pay Tokens to play and the game only gives you limited number to start with. After you use those up you will have to pay real money to get more. Also, the game only offers the basic map and ruleset for new players. You'll have to buy your access to those other game modes advertised in the game's description. They arent cheap either. They even lock the AI behind a paywall, only allowing you to play 3 player games unless you pay for an upgrade. Who wants to play 3 player risk? Bleah!

Algos are friggin ridiculous. I have taken to keeping track. and for a summary. I watch each other player move 5 to 8 countries with no loss, I am lucky for 2. I am always getting a negative ratio on loss to kills, while I watch other players get astronomical rolls and just wipe. I think its bs. This is on balanced, true, game types. all.

This game, whilst an interesting concept of having one troop hold down a whole country, is pretty mid. I would like yo confess that I lost because the dice are not fair. Like rigged for real. Maybe I'll play this as an actual board game so that I can actually fight people in real life and not with a dice. (JK)

Reddit doesn't have any answers, just others running into the same issue, tried disabling controller input in steam and restarting and neither of those fixed it. It sucks since the bug makes the game literally unplayable and I was actually enjoying the gameplay of this. 

There also might be cheaters in the online portion. There were some players that would go in with like 25 troops against my 30 and would just take the territory while only losing like 5 troops. Idk how else to explain something like that without mentioning cheating.
the RNG dice game is rigged. i went 5 soldiers vs 1 soldier in single dice rolls and lost all soldiers. GG
Full of hackers who game the dice. A real shame as it makes what should be a great game absolutely terrible (strategy becomes redundant). Why people cheat is beyond me but that is another issue.

absolute 100% luck based. You CANNOT win with skill. Its full gambling. zero skill.
There are about 50% bots in the game (even in ranked) and they will play 100% random.
And it doesnt matter what you do, you will not outskill anyone here. Its 100% coinflip if u win

Same broken dice.  The game is not worth playing until the horrible dice programming is changed.   It is what it is.  Play it in person instead. Seems to also be a game built on micro-transactions.  And to answer the developer that responded before blocking me from playing the game again, the dice programming you claim to have fixed... its still broken.... badly... broken.
just cheaters, or people that stall, and when you finally get a decent match youll get rolled on cap 5v4 and they will lose only a troop on balanced blitz, its a joke, rarely update

The developers rig the dice rolls for the computer which makes the game unplayable. I am glad I wasted less than 5 minutes on this obvious nostalgia bait you into buying something. Even though the game is free you would have a much more valuable Risk experience playing the classic IRL version with real people and legittemate dice rolls.

The bots, and  prorgramd  "blitz" are horrific. I have consistantly loss to with overwhelming or similar troop levels. I would  never have reported a negative post  but this is insane to lose this 5+ times in a row in this fashion.  Fix it now!!!! It's unreal.

I cannot explain for the life of me how I lose statistically improbable fights every time I play with players and win every time against bots. Is it some pay to win benefit, is it hacking, is it bad luck. I despise this game, and I suppose I never liked it when I was a kid either. The entire thrill of it was watching a board being filled with miniatures. The dice rolling makes the game 100% chance based (there are ways to adjust this to some extent). I am not a great strategist and I am no positional expert, which makes unclear borders even harder to read and defend. So I may be just biased and unlucky; but I still wouldn't recommend the game to anyone.

I enjoy myself some Risk, but the fact that there is 0 reason for someone not to quit a game is game ruining. Risk already takes a while to play, and when 2-4 people every game bot out turn 2, each time taking the full clock for their turns, it's a fucking joke. 

If and or when they fix that, and improve the in game report system, and add checks to stop people cheating, and maybe also give some actual incentive to play the game beyond earning useless points, theeeeen I can change to a positive.

its free, and its risk. the monetization is a little crazy, and the token system is a LOT frustrating, but if you just want to play base risk, this works pretty well as a digital stand in. i still cant recommend it though, as 99% of the content is either locked behind a paywall or WAY too much grinding. if you really want to play risk and just regular risk, its worthwhile, but you may as well just get tabletop sim and have pretty much every board game ever (risk included.) digitzing board games is tough and i respect that, but this doesnt give me much of a reason to play this instead of physical risk, which is what really gets me.

Honestly I love risk and these style of games in general. But in its current state I cannot suggest this game. It wants you to do nothing and hope you dont upset someone to win. You will sit there for hours doing the same thing over and over just to lose because some dude got upset because you tried to progress the game. Basically the last person to get bored wins. I know its kind of the way risk is but it seems off here. Maybe its a player thing but regardless its painful and it saddens me to say I dont really want to play anymore.

there were never any video, resolution, or window settings, and now they add more bugs to the game as time goes on. now if people leave the game and are marked MIA, it can take nearly 2 hours for the deployment phase to end, which is super boring and there is very little indication of when it is your turn, making it easy to stare at the screen for over an hour and randomly lose anyway.

i will keep playing it until i find a better competitive risk game. i wish there was a competitive platform to play risk ii (from the year 2000) on. check out myabandonware /game/risk-ii-be5

Even though I really liked the games the devs have completely ruined the going offline bit. I got roped into a two fucking hour long (currently ongoing) zombies Africa campaign, ignoring the racial undertones of fucking having the least developed continent being home of zombies, what the fuck is the logic of the fucking reinforcements. We were one turn away from ending the campaign then the zombies decided a 30 stack in Syria looked particularly tasty and just *poof* grabbed the thing. WHAT. Then when the zombies only had 2 territories they get a +98 reinforcement. Great game, 10/10.

This game is chock full of cheaters. If you don't have the ability to play dozens of matches a day it doesn't matter how good you are at the game, it boils down to the luck of your matches. They have made no significant changes to help solve the problem in years. If you're OK with that, feel free to play this game, but as of now, I am uninstalling until there is actual significant dev work on the ranked system to not just discourage, but make it nigh impossible for people to cheat. Do not give them money until this is fixed.

Either the game becomes unplayably long because players go MIA requiring the timer to run out before each MIA player completes their turn or you have cheats who enter a game with two or more accounts which gang up on other players. I suppose I can't blame them for cheating, they are not intelligent enough to win fairly.

Absolutely not. Walked into it hoping for a similar board-game Risk and walked out disappointed with a mostly luck based game. Sure on Risk you also have the luck factor with dice, but 1st, the attacked territory can defend itself, not just based on the attacker's number of troops, and 2nd the amount of troops you get for a set of cards is according to how many sets you get i.e. 1st set 4 troops, 2nd set 6 troops and so on. To get 10 troops on your first set based off of the cards you get is outrageous and will put in in an enormous disadvantage at the beginning. Don't recommend if you're looking for a game that's actually based off of strategy and skill and not random chance and luck.

One of the worst risk games out there, run by a very shady company.  I highly recommend you avoid this.  This company openly acknowledges it's shady behaviour, too, on their discord server.  They regularly wrongly ban players who spend real money on the game, hoping it causes them to create a new account to re-purchased in-game content.  They don't even deny their methods.  Lawyers need to get involved.  As bad as that is, the players are some of the worst.  Cheaters are everywhere and nothing is done about it.  As far as I can tell, only legit players are punished.  Truly evil.  If not for cheaters, you have cowards who only accept new members (i.e., newbs) into their lobbies for easy wins.  

So., in summary: you rarely find a legitimate game, due to rampant cheating and cowards, and the game developers openly admit they ban you without cause, and they refuse to change their ways. AVOID THIS GAME!!!  I hope a lawyer see's this and sues them.
